image.altText: a man wearing an official khaki uniform

props.synopsis: The NT's corrections commissioner says there's been a "substantial" amount of lockdowns across territory prisons in recent months, due to record inmate numbers and staff shortages.

title.children: Lockdowns 'all of the time' across NT prisons, as inmate numbers soar

image.altText: A photo showing a white dog with black spots behind a cage.

props.synopsis: Animal shelters in the NT are facing a crisis as more and more pet owners surrender their animals due to cost of living pressures. Advocates say stricter regulations on backyard breeding could ease the burden.

title.children: Shelters 'overwhelmed' as owners struggle to afford keeping pets

image.altText: A close up shot of a man wearing a chequered shirt.

props.synopsis: The Northern Territory is about to become only the second jurisdiction in Australia to allow people to carry and use pepper spray, but the laws might be stricter than you think.

title.children: 'Misguided': Peak Aboriginal health body slams NT pepper spray trial

image.altText: Chalk drawings on a footpath read "the truth matters" and "love matters".

props.synopsis: The NT police union says a probe into the fatal police shooting of Kumanjayi Walker in 2019 shows the force can be "impartial" when investigating deaths in custody.

title.children: Police union backs officers involved in Kumanjayi White death in custody

image.altText: A group of Aboriginal men walk through the town of Alice Springs, one man holding a protest sign.

props.synopsis: The peak body for Indigenous legal services says the prime minister is "missing in action" and should convene a national cabinet meeting over rising Aboriginal incarceration rates and deaths in custody.

title.children: PM accused of being 'missing in action' on Indigenous deaths in custody

image.altText: A patch of the NT police force emblem on an unidentified officer's uniform

props.synopsis: Northern Territory police are investigating two separate incidents of women being indecently assaulted in their beds in Darwin.

title.children: Two women woken by intruders in separate incidents within 24 hours

image.altText: A square blue sign with white and blue checkers that reads 'Police' in the focused background, blurred blue pole in foreground

props.synopsis: A Northern Territory police officer is in custody after being arrested and charged with two counts of rape over an incident that allegedly occurred while he was off duty last year.

title.children: Investigators charge NT police officer with two counts of rape

image.altText: A man in a blue hospital gown lying in bed, being visited by a man with gray hair and white clothes.

props.synopsis: The 40-year-old British national is the sole known survivor of the crash, which happened shortly after take-off on Thursday, local time.

title.children: Sole survivor jumped from emergency exit in Air India plane crash

image.altText: A police vehicle on the far side of the road

props.synopsis: A man has died two weeks after becoming unresponsive during an arrest in Adelaide's eastern suburbs, his partner has told the ABC.

title.children: SA man dies two weeks after becoming unresponsive during arrest

image.altText: Anthony Albanese Press Club speech

props.synopsis: Less than six weeks into his second term as prime minister, Anthony Albanese's honeymoon has been interrupted by his first real test: Donald Trump.

image.altText: Donald Trump frowns.

props.synopsis: A US appeals court has temporarily blocked a federal judge's order that directed President Donald Trump to return control of National Guard troops to California.

image.altText: A sketch of a woman with long brown hair in a purple top frowning in front of a cream backdrop.

image.altText: Plastics Recycling 2024-07-16 09:07:00

props.synopsis: Imported plastic, which makes up most of Australia's plastic waste, is being scrutinised as the nation joins a global "wake-up call" to end plastic pollution.

title.children: Australia eyes plastic imports as it joins global 'wake-up call' on waste

image.altText: Australian currency notes and coins scattered

props.synopsis: The Australian dollar falls heavily against the US dollar, losing 1 per cent against the greenback in the space of a couple of hours on the news of Israel's air strikes on Iran. The Aussie is often seen as a proxy for global financial and political instability.

title.children: Australian dollar dives as Israel's strike on Iran shakes markets

image.altText: Four people sit close together as they pose for a picture.

title.children: Court hears boys left fatally wounded GP lying lifeless on ground

title.children: Pallister breaks 800m record and embraces Dawn Fraser in emotional scenes

image.altText: A palawa woman stands facing the camera in front of an artwork

props.synopsis: Lawyers say changes forcing defendants in regional NSW to apply for bail via an online hook-up may have unintended consequences.

title.children: Online bail hearings may have 'dire consequences', legal experts warn

image.altText: A barren white and red salt flat sprawls out towards the horizon, under a blue sky.

image.altText: Temba Bavuma, Pat Cummins and Marnus Labuschagne.

image.altText: A man with an eyebrow piercing and moustache.

title.children: Gin Gin man James Wood faces court on weapons charges

title.children: 'Complete township' created in Tassie for new Netflix series

image.altText: Police tape and bloodied steps at a home with a gate in it

title.children: Jury finds NSW man guilty of attack on brother that led to amputation

image.altText: Preston and Heidelberg players on the pitch in front of a huge team flag that says Preston Makedonia F.C

props.synopsis: An investigation involving a Melbourne soccer club, Victoria Police and Football Victoria is underway after multiple spectators reported hearing a "monkey-type" chant during a game in Victoria's top soccer league last week.

title.children: Racist chant at soccer match referred to Football Victoria, police

props.synopsis: Essendon winger Xavier Duursma says country kids who make it to the AFL carry a deep pride in where they've come from — as well as a "chip of their shoulder" given the extra challenges they've faced to get there.

title.children: 'Chip on your shoulder': Players from the country carry a special pride

image.altText: Joan places a peg on her nose and takes a selfie in Slanted.

title.children: The Australian behind the Crazy Rich Asians sequel on her debut feature

image.altText: Large plumes of smoke rise from a forested mountain ridge during sunset.

props.synopsis: An inquiry into the devastating Orroral Valley fire near Canberra in 2020 has found the crew of a Defence helicopter who accidentally started the blaze made an "error of judgement" in not notifying authorities of the fire.

title.children: Inquiry finds ADF crew made 'error' in not reporting Orroral Valley fire

image.altText: bayswater power station

props.synopsis: Bayswater Power Station is one of NSW's last coal-fired power stations. As it celebrates its 40th anniversary, workers know its days are numbered.

title.children: Workers at 40yo power station excited for 'transition out of coal'

image.altText: Simon Goodwin with his arm around Kysaiah Pickett

props.synopsis: Melbourne coach Simon Goodwin calls Kysaiah Pickett's decision to re-commit to the club a massive endorsement of the club's oft-criticised culture.

title.children: Goodwin says Pickett's $12m extension proof Melbourne's culture 'in good order'

image.altText: The SES and Victoria Police are rescuing about 20 people stuck on Mount Hotham.

props.synopsis: From the Socceroos qualifying for the FIFA World Cup to popular sunscreens not passing SPF testing, it was another big week in news. Test yourself on what you remember.

title.children: Weekly news quiz: An epic Roland-Garros final, stranded travellers and a quirky unofficial town mascot

image.altText: Tasmanian Labor party's campaign launch in Hobart 2025-06-12 10:06:00

props.synopsis: Following a week of political mudslinging, Tasmanian Premier Jeremy Rockliff and Labor leader Dean Winter say they will attempt to project a "positive" image for the state in the freshly started election campaign.

title.children: Stadium, ships and stability — parties make first pitch in Tasmanian election nobody wanted

image.altText: clothes drying outdoors

props.synopsis: It has been a frosty start to winter, but for many areas of Australia the lower temperatures are coinciding with faster drying clothes.

title.children: Why the winter cold is no barrier to hanging out your clothes
